page.title: 06MONTFORD BRIDGE CRAFT CENTRE
page.content:
A new Craft and Hobby centre is becoming established in Montford Bridge near the Wingfield Arms.
Over 200 years ago the building was a Smithy mainly used for the shoeing of horses. The building was then converted into a private house and in 1984 the house was sold to a local man, Mr J. Kelsall, who converted it into a shop and workshop.
The centre gives daily exhibitions of a variety of crafts. These include printing, tile making, jewellery, carpentry, painting, photography and metalwork.
